[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource] [Snapshot consistency] Do state snapshots capture consistent AggregatorResource values, or can snapshots show impossible intermediate states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: primary_apt_store()] [Fork safety] During chain forks, can primary_apt_store() derivation produce different results on different forks, causing fund loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: FungibleStoreResource] [Schema change] If FungibleStoreResource struct layout changes in protocol upgrade, can old serialized data be deserialized incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource] [Aggregator upgrade] Can upgrading AggregatorResource implementation break existing ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource instances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Flag semantics change] If MigrationFlag semantics change in upgrade, can this enable unauthorized migrations of already-migrated accounts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: balance()] [Information leak] Does balance() expose balance information without authorization checks, enabling privacy attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: frozen()] [Unauthorized freeze check] Can any account query frozen status of arbitrary stores, revealing regulatory actions or sanctions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: metadata()] [Metadata enumeration] Can attackers enumerate all metadata addresses to discover token types and exploit vulnerabilities in specific implementations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: FungibleStoreResource] [Total supply violation] Can sum of all FungibleStoreResource balances exceed the metadata's declared total supply, indicating minting vulnerability? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource] [Concurrent inflation] Can concurrent balance updates across multiple ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource instances cause total supply to inflate? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: FungibleStoreResource] [Deflation attack] Can an attacker burn funds by setting balance=0 without proper accounting, causing unexpected deflation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: FungibleStoreResource] [Owner validation] Is there validation that only the store owner can modify balance/frozen fields, or can any account manipulate any store? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: primary_apt_store()] [Unauthorized access] Can an attacker derive primary_apt_store for victim accounts and access their stores without proper authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Flag authority] Who can set MigrationFlag? Can unauthorized accounts enable migration for others' stores? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: primary_apt_store()] [Hash function weakness] Does create_derived_object_address use a cryptographically secure hash? Can preimage attacks reverse-engineer creator addresses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Function: primary_apt_store()] [Collision resistance] With SHA3-256, what is the birthday bound for address collisions? Can attackers exploit birthday paradox to generate colliding stores? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: FungibleStoreResource] [Signature binding] Are FungibleStoreResource modifications properly signed? Can unsigned modifications be injected by network attackers? (Critical)
